name: Instant Pot® Creamy Vanilla Rice Pudding
author: Diana71
summary: This is an extra-rich rice pudding made with short grain rice, a nod to my Okinawan heritage. The recipe calls for already-cooked short-grain rice (likely from a rice cooker) and is a great way to use leftover rice. Make it for breakfast, as a snack, or serve it for dessert! Add additional milk or cream to each bowl when serving, if you like.
ingredients: 1 pinch ground cinnamon, or as needed
directions: Combine cooked rice, 2 cups milk, sugar, and salt in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and stir well
Select porridge function according to manufacturer's instructions and seal the vent
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
Unlock and carefully remove the lid
Whisk egg yolks together well in a bowl
Add a small amount of cooked porridge and whisk quickly into yolks
Pour mixture into the pot and stir to combine well with rice
Add heavy cream, remaining milk, and vanilla extract
Serve rice pudding in individual bowls garnished with cinnamon
